awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Italy Cooperative Workshop on the Theoretical and      Computational Aspects of the Hilbert Function
awd_abstract_narration: 9214121  Sturmfels    This award will support a joint U.S.-Italian  workshop on the theoretical and computational  aspects of Hilbert functions, organized by Bernd  Sturmfels, Cornell University, and Lorenzo Robbiano,  University of Genoa, Italy.  The objective of this  binational workshop will be to advance this subject  area through discussion and comparison of the  different aspects of Hilbert functions by a small  number of selected participants.    There will be 25 workshop participants, ten of which  will be Italians, as well as ten graduate students  and postdoctorate fellows from Cornell and other  U.S. institutions.  Important open problems in the  theory of Hilbert functions will be addressed,  including the structure of zero-dimensional schemes,  algorithms for computing Hilbert functions and  finite free resolutions, Hilbert functions of  algebras with special structural properties, and  combinatorial methods and polyhedral invariants of  projective varieties.  The participants' papers will  be published in a well-established monograph series.   ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
